meanings.definition: The quality of being fair and impartial.
meanings.sent1: Her decision showed great justnesses in treating everyone equally.
meanings.sent2: The judge's ruling was based on the justnesses of the law.
meanings.sent3: In a world full of biases, his commitment to justnesses was refreshing.
meanings.sent4: The justnesses of her actions shone brightly in the darkness of injustice.
meanings.sent5: The justnesses of the system ensured that all voices were heard and considered.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being morally right or righteous.
meanings.sent1: His justnesses in always doing the right thing inspired others.
meanings.sent2: The justnesses of his character were evident in every decision he made.
meanings.sent3: Even in the face of temptation, he held onto his justnesses.
meanings.sent4: The justnesses of his soul guided him through difficult moral dilemmas.
meanings.sent5: She strived to live a life filled with justnesses and integrity.
